Taxon name.Name: Rhodococcus ruber
Taxon name.Synonymy: Current name: Rhodococcus ruber (Kruse 1896) Goodfellow and Alderson 1977 (Approved Lists 1980) emend. Nouioui et al. 2018 MB#

Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: documents providing proof of legal access and terms of use available at the collection
Isolator: Ground water, oilfield outline zone, Perm region, Russia
Metabolites production: Produces biosurfactants when growing on n-hexadecane; transforms thioanisole to methyl phenyl sulfoxide.
Applications: Uses propane, n-butane and n-hexadecane as a sole carbon source; transforms thioanisole; resistant to Cr6+, Сu2+, Pb2+ (5.0 mM), VO2+ (12.5 mM), VO43- (100.0 mM), VO3- (>250.0 mM); adheres to liquid hydrocarbons (n-hexadecane); produces biosurfactants when growing on n-hexadecane.
